subject: Business
title: Communicating Vision: Making the Abstract Real
description: One-minute skill: Communicating Vision: Making the Abstract Real.

hook.text: JFK didn't say 'improve our space program.' He said 'put a man on the Moon by the end of this decade.'

buildup.text: A vision must be vivid, time-bound, and emotionally compelling to move people to action.

discovery.text: Abstract visions like 'be the best' are forgotten. Concrete ones like 'a computer on every desk' stick.

twist.text: Most leaders communicate vision once and assume it landed. Research shows it takes 7+ repetitions to sink in.

climax.text: Martin Luther King Jr. repeated 'I have a dream' nine times in one speech. Repetition is not redundancy.

punchline.text: If you're tired of saying it, they're just starting to hear it.

quiz.question: Why must leaders repeat their vision many times?
options: People need 7+ exposures before a message truly sinks in
Leaders forget what they said previously
Repetition makes the vision sound more authoritative
